frameDefinitions: This frame contains words for types of noise which can be used to characterize verbal communication.

A Speaker talks about a Topic, which may be an action performed by the Speaker or an entity or state of affairs that they are associated with in order to suggest that the Speaker is worthy of admiration.
A physical entity, construed as a point-Sound_source, emits a Sound.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
frameExamples: 'Don't treat me as a child!' she <t>cried</t> scornfully.
Turkish officials <t>boasted</t> of giving 'tens of thousands of dollars in surreptitious payments' to a prominent American politician.
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
Message has a number of different realizations in this frame, including <ment>that</ment>-clauses, direct quotes, infinitival complements, <ment>for-to</ment> phrases, and NP Objects.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>.
The <fen>Voice</fen> describes the <fex name=''>Speaker'</fex>s utterance or other message-encoded production.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Communication noise event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an event occurs.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who produces a message about a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a positively judged entity or state of affairs with which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is associated and about which they talk.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
A description of the state of affairs that redounds to the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s credit
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action that conveys the feeling of pride of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.

The frame element <fen>Sound_source</fen> is assigned to a constituent referring to a physical entity which emits a sound. Such an entity must have an appropriately complex internal structure such that it can create a sound. For example, a machine or some other thing with moving parts can create sound by itself.

The frame element <fen>Sound</fen> is incorporated in the meaning of the verbs of this frame. Otherwise, this role is assigned to NPs which actually refer to a sound in the presence of the target. This typically occurs when the target is a verb used as a modifier in its <ment>-ing</ment> form, e.g.:
An event in which one or more <fen>Sound_source</fen>s participate and which is accompanied by <fen>Sound</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Noisy_event</fen> occurs.

The location of the <fen>Sound_source</fen>. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_source</fen> only in terms of point of view; the latter role implies a point of view that is not on the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Kim</fex> whined that it wasn't fair.
Kim whined <fex>that it wasn't fair</fex>.
Kim howled <fex>about the unfairness of it all</fex>.
<fex>John's voice</fex> bellowed for her to be quiet.
During the 1990s <fex>Rio Grande Do Sul's governor, Olivio Dutra of the PT,</fex> PREENED about the province's GE-free status.
Mike Wallace was told that Canseco had bragged <fex>about steroids</fex>.
CNN's Jeff Greenfield bragged <fex>on the air</fex> recently that ratings are high.
Cosmai BRAGGED <fex>that Hyundai's latest quality rankings place the automaker on par with Honda and Toyota</fex>.
The senator's boastful <fex>exaggerations of her academic record at a New Hampshire campaign event</fex> also contributed to her withdrawal.

The public does not care, but the media definitely do as Haddock herself boasted
<fex>the next morning</fex> on Good Morning America.
'I'm Pat Crowe,' he boasted <fex>at the police station</fex>.
<fex>The wind</fex> howled.
The branches made a rattling <fex>sound</fex>.
<fex>The conversations</fex> droned on
It's going to beep again <fex>in two minutes</fex>.
A bat squeaked <fex>over our heads</fex>.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.
